conclusion: Analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph to determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second.
The graph shows the position x of the car as a function of time t.
The y-axis represents x/t in meters per second (m/s), essentially the velocity.
The x-axis represents time t in seconds (s).
The graph shows a straight line, indicating constant velocity.
The line passes through the point (0, 10) and extends linearly.
The line starts at t = -2 and x/t = 0, and goes through t = 0 and x/t = 10.
The slope of the line in an x-t graph represents the velocity.
Calculate the slope m of the line using the formula m = (10 - 0) / (0 - (-2)) = 10/2 = 5 m/s.
The slope represents the constant velocity of the car.
Since the velocity is constant, the speed at any time t is the same.
The speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
